RE872-d-12-23-87-BS.Narrative: ON DECEMBER 23, 1987, AT APPROXIMATELY 1 A.M., THE #9 ENSLEY ROUSTER CREW DISCOVERED A WRECK WHERE CARS ON TRACK NO. 25 HAD BEEN SHOVED INTOCARS WHICH HAD BEEN SET OUT ON TRACK #26, FOULING THE NORTHEND OF TRACK 25. THE #9 ENSLEY ROUSTER CREW HAD GONE ON DUTY AT 34TH STREET YARD AT 11:30 P.M. ON DECEMBER 22, 1987. INVESTIGATION TO DETERMINE WHENINCIDENT OCCURRED AND PERSONS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACCIDENT WAS UNDERTAKEN. POST ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION REVEALED TRACK NO. 26 CONTAINED 21 TANK CARS WHICH WERE IN STORAGE FOR ALLIED CORPORATION, FAIRFIELD PLANTALL BUT ONE OF THE CARS ON TRACK NO. 26 CONTAINED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL AND/OR REGULATED SUBSTANCES. CARS ON TRACK NO. 26 HAD BEEN REPORTED NOT INTHE CLEAR BY ABOUT TWO CAR LENGTHS ON THE NORTH END OF THE YARD FOR SEVERAL DAYS PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT. POST ACCIDENT INVESTIGATIONS ALSO REVEALED A CUT OF 26 CARS IN TRACK NO. 25. TWENTY-TWO OF THESE CARS CONTAINED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AND/OR REGULATED SUBSTANCES........NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
